column1: what a start! down the track, picks it up on the half-volley and sends it soaring over long-on. Welcome back Mohammad Shahzad!
down the track again but this was not as full and he defends it outside off
fuller length on off, and Shahzad shows a full bat face to defend it

leading edge caught at mid-off Shahzad is staying put, he thinks it might have bounced in front of the fielder. And the umpires think so too, with the soft signal being not out. This was angled into Shahzad and he wanted to flick it away, but a hint of movement meant he got the leading edge. Cameron-Dow at mid-off ran in and went low to grab the ball. But does he have fingers underneath the ball? He certainly appears to have done so. And the third umpire agrees! Shahzad has to go. Six off the first ball, out off the fourth.
good length, nipping in off the seam a bit and ends up on the pads. Easily flicked to deep square leg to get off the mark
good length on off, coming in again, takes the inside edge to square leg from his forward defensive prod
full ball on the stumps, defended from the crease
length ball outside off, rears up a bit and takes the shoulder of the bat to run down to third man
length ball on middle stump this time and nipping in, he goes on the back foot to tuck it to deep square leg
very full on off, driven punchily but without timing and straight to mid-off
fuller outside off and he unleashes a pleasing square drive, but the placement isn't as good as the timing, and he can't find the gap. Straight to point
shot back of a length outside off and he stands tall, transfers weight back and cuts it past point for a boundary
a half skip down the track and he drives this one from outside off. Straight to mid-off though
defended into the offside. Length ball, angling into the batsman and straightens a bit, dealt with well
good length around off stump again, and he takes a step forward to defend
keeps to the good length area around the fourth stump and Rahmat defends it to point, getting nicely behind the line of the ball
good length on the stumps, seemed to hold up a bit and he ends up playing it back straight. It popped in the air for a bit, but fell short of the bowler
good length on the stumps, he moves across to flick it, but can't go past midwicket. Maiden
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot

under edge misses the stumps given a bit room outside off with a back of length ball, and he tried to cut it hard, but only under-edged it. Unlucky for the bowler, it missed the stumps but great work by the keeper to dive to his left and stop the ball.
nails the slap this time, forcing shot off the back foot to a similar length ball outside off and he times it beautifully and into the gap
fullish outside off, defended off the front foot
fuller ball on off, driven confidently back to the bowler
length ball on the stumps, not short enough to pull, but he tries to rock back and pull it anyway. doesn't get any timing on it and the ball rolls away into the legside off the lower half of the bat
fuller ball on off, driven to mid-off
comes down the track and has to wait for the ball. Clipped off his pads to square leg
good length, coming in from outside off, defended to point
back of a length and Rahmat was coming forward to it, ends up defending with the ball hitting him high on the bat
dropped by Kevin O'Brien at short mid-on Driven by Ahmadi firmly to Kevin's left. He had to get down low and it hit his palm but rolled away.
skips down the track but pats it back to the bowler
too far down leg and that will be a wide

dropped by the bowler This was easier than the one Kevin O'Brien put down just five minutes ago. He drove it back to the bowler but Rankin couldn't hold on, even though it wasn't hit with extreme power
fuller, clipped to mid-on and they go through for a quick single. Fumble by the fielder makes it easy
back of a length outside off, getting it to bounce a bit and he keeps it down nicely
back of length outside off again, punched back to the bowler but without any timing
fuller on off, driven firmly. Cover fumbles but there is protection in the in-field and they can't get a run
back of a length on off again, and he pushes it to the bowler's left
wide outside off, he comes down the pitch and pushes it towards point. Some bit of away movement for the bowler
down the track again, this one is fuller and closer to off stump, and he drives it nicely but can't pierce the infield
too straight and flicked off the pads to deep midwicket. Hung in the air for a while, but no fielder was near it
dismissed Too full and he just stands and delivers, unleashing a big swing that lifts the ball way over deep midwicket
better length, on the stumps, Ahmadi takes a step across and tucks it to midwicket
back of a length outside off, nipping in, punched towards mid-on
given some air, fullish length outisde off. He defends off the front foot
fair bit of turn, pitched outside off and spinning back in sharply. Slapped to point
turned around the corner off the front foot but Kevin O'Brien dives to his right to prevent runs
struck on the pads but well outside off. He had gone down on one knee to sweep, but ends up missing it
down the track to flick to midwicket
flatter and shorter, spinning in from outside off, he goes down on one knee and paddle-pulls it to deep midwicket
good length outside off, driven off the front foot, but can't go past mid-off
good length outside off, defended from the crease
good length outside off, and defended again
angled in on a length, skips down the wicket and picks it up aerially towards deep squareleg
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
full on off, half a stride forward and defends to cover
length on off, bit of spin back in, shuffles and pushes it to midwicket
quicker one on middle, keeps a tad low as he attempts a pull, hurried onto him, massive appeal for lbw turned down
length on the pads, tucked around the corner past squareleg for two
full outside off, lunges forward and defends
full outside off, shuffles across and goes to sweep it, can't connect, however, struck outside the line
full on off, lunges forward and defends
comes on the front foot to drive this form outside off, but the ball stopped on him a bit
steered to point
flatter, angling into him, he moves back and clips it to square leg
strays on the pads, but Rahmat's not been in the best touch. Only flicks it to midwicket
outside off and driven past cover
good length on middle and off, spinning away, he punches it off the back foot to deep cover
tosses it up wide outside off and Ahmadi slaps it through point
tossed up closer to off stump and Rahmat comes on the front foot to defend

bowled him through the gate tossed up outside off and spinning back in sharply, suckered Ahmadi into an ambitious drive. Dipped, gripped and turned in through the big gap to rattle the stumps. Ahmadi couldn't resist going for it but he has to pay the price

big appeal, but the umpire says no bat This was another lovely dipping and looping delivery, pitched outside off and turned, seemed to defeat Asghar's forward prod and took his pad to leg-slip. Ireland thought there was an edge onto pad there, but the umpire didn't
down the track, probably in response to the previous ball and pushed to the bowler's right
stays in his crease that time and turns it around the corner
tossed up outside off and he goes for the drive. Cover dives to his right but the though the ball was in the air, it was a little too far from him
tossed up well outside off again and he drives it to deep cover
good length outside off, draws him forward and he steers it towards point
driven off the back foot to deep cover
tossed up, good length outside off. He's staying beside the ball and goes with his hands towards the ball, steering it to point
defended off the front foot
tossed up but a bit too full, he moves across and nurdles it to fine leg

great bowling, he's getting it to go above the eye line and dip, then turn. this one came in sharply again from outside off and defeated the attempt to turn it to the onside, and hit him high on the pads
fuller on the stumps, turned to the onside
too far down legside and that is a wide. Still sharp turn
down the track and clipped to short mid-on
tossed up again, very full, driven back off the toe end to the bowler
tossed up again and he's down the track again, drives it to short mid-on
tossed up outside off, on a sixth stump line, gets him to drive, but he can't go past the in-field
too short and he rocks back to pounce on it quickly. Pulls it powerfully over midwicket for a much-needed hit

and he's been done in by the bowler Dockrell keeps it on a length and gets it to grip on the pitch and stop. Rahmat wanted to get on with it, and was shaping to cut, but ends up too early into the shot and can only spoon a dolly to point. End of a laboured innings

gone first ball! Dockrell has been tossing them up outside off and inviting the Afghan batsmen to drive against the turn. Shinwari does that, without moving his feet and only gets a toe-end that pops up straight to cover for a simple catch.
so close to a hat-trick good length, pitches on off and turns past the bat, just missing the outside edge. Nabi had come forward to defend, but seemingly more with hope than conviction
tucked to midwicket
down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it back, but the bowler is quickly across to his left to field it
tossed up outside off and defended off the front foot
tossed up on the stumps, he takes a big stride out and works it away towards midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven on the full but straight to cover
good length outside off, turning in, he stays beside the ball and pushes it away
tossed up outside off again and driven, but without timing and straight to cover
flatter and fired in on the stumps, defended
length ball outside off, stroked towards point
good length, closer to off stump. Nabi wanted to punch it forcefully but gets an inside edge onto boot
stays in his crease and punches it past point
tossed up, too full and driven to long-off
tossed up outside off again, driven along the ground to cover
length outside off, pushed through cover, was in the air for a bit
length on off, tossed yp higher, but the slowness allows him to hang back and defend
full on off, tossed up even higher, pushed to long-off
tossed up on off, lunges forward and defends
full and angled in, misses the sweep but it's a wide
length, angled in, tries to tickle it fine but off the pad it trickles to short fine-leg
tossed up on middle, comes forward and defends safely
full on off, defended to point
full outside off, inviting him forward, he obliges and caresses it to deep cover
in the air but just short of cover! Tossed up, holds in the surface and it was chipped tantalisingly close to cover
full outside off, comes forward and defends to cover
short and punished! Rocks back and hammers it to the deep midwicket fence
tossed up on off, lunges forward and chips it wide of cover. That could have easily gone to hand, instead, they get two
full outside off, bit of spin away, half a stride forward and defended
tossed up on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on middle, pushed to long-on to retain strike
very full outside off, driven gently to long-off
tossed up closer to off stump that time, but Asghar gets inside the line and drives to point's right
a bit flatter around the fourth stump, pushed to mid-off
fired in quicker, jabbed back to the bowler
brings out the sweep, but Murtagh at short fine tumbles to his left to stop the ball. Dropped just short of him, but he got his body in the way to prevent the ball from running away
flighted outside off, he goes for the drive and misses it
some turn from outside off, going away from the batsman, who rocks back and drives it past cover
sharp turn again, pitches on a full length on the fifth stump and breaks away, he guides it with the turn towards point
tossed up too full, ends up as a full toss but Asghar only gently drives it to long-on
fuller ball, he takes a big stride out and defends
too full again, and he tries to turn it away but can't go past midwicket
tossed up again, on middle stump, pushed towards cover. No run
starts off with a flattish one on off stump, and Nabi gets his bat down quickly and defends
back of a length, pitching on middle and turning, he gets inside the line and helps it to square leg
tossed up outside off and turning into him, he jabs it away to the offside
nicely looped, and the ball drifts away from the batsman and dips. He comes down the track but can only defend it back
stays in his crease that time and goes on the back foot to turn it to midwicket
flatter on the stumps, wristed to short midwicket
almost got him He gave himself room to slap this through the offside, but it snuck under the bat, and went perilously close to off stump
sweeps, but straight to short fine
full toss, too much air, but Asghar can't smash it, just ends up driving it gently to long-on
fuller on the stumps, Nabi clears his leg and drives it to long-off

appeal for a stumping tossed up outside off, draws Asghar forward, dips on him and turns past his bat. Poynter was very quick to whip the bails off.But looks like Asghar had just got a toe back across the line. So he'll be safe
tossed up again, but a bit too full, and he drives. Gets a thick outside edge that short third man fields
length ball on middle stump and turning, he gets behind the line and punches to long-on
fuller length but still on middle, and he can play it with the turn to midwicket's right to get a single
good length outside off that time, down the track but clipped to midwicket
too full on middle and leg, flicked off his toes to deep square leg
good ball, outside off on a fullish length and sharp turn, he had gone back to it. Might have been better off coming forward. Ends up whipping it away from deep in his crease
full on off, driven to midwicket
big turn again, on a fullish length and pushed to point
a bit short, and Asghar gave himself room to slap it through the offside but picks out cover
too short again and this time he gets on top of it and slaps it into the gap past cover for four
full toss smashed Asghar has been missing out on those but this comes at a nice waist height and he smashes it over cow corner for a six. Much needed runs, Asghar was really getting bogged down
good length on the pads and turning away, he moves across to tap it to short fine leg. Thinks about a single, but decides against it
very full again, but dipping on him and he takes a big stride out to defend this outside off
fullish length outside off, he moved right across to flick it, but can't get past short fine leg
good length on off, turning away sharply, he plays with the turn to flick but again to short fine leg
good length, given some air on the stumps, worked to midwicket
fullish outside off, flicked again, but square leg fields
down the track and patted back to the bowler
full outside off, and he flicks it again. Finds the gap that time to take a single to long-on

tossed up outside off and turns in, beats the bat and strikes him on the pad. Loud appeal by bowler but the umpire is not interested. That looked a pretty good shout, but might have hit him outside the line
down the track and clipped to long-on
tossed up on a sixth stump line he goes across to flick it, but only to square leg
back of a length, he goes back and across and swats it to long-on
fuller outside off, steered to short third man
good length outside off, spinning in and pushed to cover
good length around the channel, jabbed back to the bowler
good length on off stump again, Nabi stays in his crease and defends it back
slightly fuller outside off, tapped to midwicket's right for a quick single
good length on off, nipping back in, he flicks it off his pads to fine leg
fuller outside off, pushed to cover
back of a length, gets it to bounce just below chest high, he stays in his crease and guides it to short third man
spinning in from outside off, he gets behind the line and punches it back to the bowler
down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives comfortably to long-on

scooped very fine. Cheeky shot, he went down and picked it up from outside off and sent it over his left shoulder. Good work by Paul Stirling on the fine leg fence. He ran across, and dived, got a hand to the ball and pushed it back. The momentum took him over the ropes and he athletically dived back in to parry the ball away from the boundary once again. Brilliant work, he's saved a run for his team, and shown excellent athleticism and commitment
down the track and pushed to long-on. Easy runs on offer for the batsmen against full balls there.
better length, he stays in his crease and works it away, spinning from outside off into him
down the track and has a big old heave at it, but the ball rolls to deep square leg off the bottom half of the bat
back of a length, seaming in slightly from outside off, he goes on his toes to pat it into the legside for a single
good length around off, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off and nipping in, he defends it from the crease
swinging in a bit and raps him on the pads. Half-hearted appeal, but going down leg
good length outside off, he can only push it to cover
fuller on the stumps, he gets his bat down in time to pat it back
fuller outside off, he stays in his crease and glides it to deep point to bring up the 50-run stand
too full on the toes, driven gently to long-on
tossed up on off, he works it to square leg by coming well forward
slightly short and he stays in his crease and transfers weight back to cut it to the man on the point fence
swing and a miss good length and line, on off. He went down to sweep it powerfully but the ball dipped and turned past the bat. Turned too much though and missed off stump
given some air outside off, defended into the off side
smashed that is just disdainfully put away by Nabi. Fullish ball outside off, he spotted it early, took a step down the track and lofted it over long-on, easy as you like
fuller on the stump again, punch-driven to long-on

back of a length outside off, whipped to midwicket. They hesitate and then go for the single. Some good fielding by the man at midwicket, but his throw was too far and by the time the stumps are broken by the keeper the batsman's made it
lovely shot, full on the stumps and he stands tall in his crease and punches it past the bowler. Long-on runs around, slides and fields
very full again, outside off, tapped past the bowler for an easy single to long-on
slower bouncer, he waits for it and pulls it down to fine leg for a boundary. Expensive over, 15 from it
floated up on off, he wanted to sweep it fine, but misses the ball and is struck on the pad. Stifled appeal turned down
flatter outside off, he goes down the track and clips it to long-on
tossed up well outside off, he moved very far across and wanted to nurdle it to fine leg, but can only get it as far as short fine

leading edge dropped by Balbirnie at mid-off tossed up, Asghar came down the track and wanted to send this over cow corner, but only got a leading edge. It went spiralling in the air, and Balbirnie was running back, calling for it. Got under the ball and got both hands to it, but couldn't hold on. These misses could prove costly for Ireland
given some air, clipped to midwicket
given some air outside off, on a length, driven but takes a thick inside edge to square leg
ooh, that turned. Drifts in, pitches on leg and breaks sharply. Nabi follows it with his hands and gets an outside edge that rolls away towards short third man
flighted, drifts on the pads, defended off the front foot
tossed up outside off, grips and turns past the bat. Nabi wanted to punch it but can't lay bat on ball
goes straight with the arm and he jabs it towards midwicket
flatter, on middle stump and turns a bit, but he comes forward to defend with the full face of the bat
fired in, and he goes back to punch it to the bowler's right. Maiden over
tossed up outside off, he comes forward and steers it to point's left
tossed up outside off, down the track he comes and gets a thickish leading edge that rolls to long-off. Closed the face of the bat too early
flighted on a length outside off, he moves back and across and swats it past the bowler to long-on
clipped to long-on
on a length outside off and spinning into him, he goes deep in his crease to whip it to long-on

got him! last ball before the drinks break, Simi kept it back of a length and spinning in. Nabi has been staying beside the ball and punching through the offside, but this time he stays too much inside the line and the ball takes a thick outside edge and nestles into the keeper's gloves. Important wicket for Ireland.
full outside off, comes forward and defends
angled in, tucked away to deep squareleg
full on middle, defended to midwicket
full on off, defended back to the bowler
full outside off and out comes the reverse sweep, he nails it to the left of short third-man and it races away to the fence
full on the pads, nudged to short fine-leg
full on off, shuffles across and tucks it away towards squareleg
length on off, flatter and quicker, hint of turn and some extra bounce, gets hi,m on the splice but safely along the ground, past slip
full outside off, goes for the conventional sweep this time, misses, there's an appeal for lbw, but he was struck way outside
length outside off, pushed to long-off
full on off, skips down the wicket and pushes it towards midwicket for one

He's slogged that high up in the air and Asghar gets another life! Fielding blemishes continue to let bowlers down, and that was the captain. Angled in, he goes for the slog sweep, it went straight up, Porterfield had an age to get under it and perhaps that was the problem as he puts down a dolly
full outside off, pushed to point
length outside off, spinning back in, pushed to deep point's right for two
length outside off, can't interest the batsman to play it, left alone
length on middle, defended back

length outside off, shuffles across to lap it over the keeper, who was alert to the opportunity, showing great anticipation and nearly pulled off a blinder, but he got just enough behind it to get it over
length on middle, tucked away past midwicket
full and angled in, defended to midwicket
length on off, flat and quick, defended back from the crease
sharp turn and beaten! Full on off, drawing him forward, and beating the bat with vicious turn away
full toss, tucked away to squareleg
full outside off, pushes forward, there's no turn there, beats the outside edge

outside edge and that's a brilliant take from the keeper! Length outside off, he rocked back to punch it through the covers, it straightened instead of spinning back in and bounced a little extra taking the outside edge, safely pouched by the keeper
length outside off, spinning further away, somehow manages to reach it and push it to deep point to get off the mark
length outside off, goes back and pushes it to long-off
flat and fast on middle, pushed to long-on
short outside off, punched to cover
full outside off, draws him forward, pushed through the covers for one
short outside off, hangs back and punches it to deep cover
full on off, slower this time, sharp spin back into the batsman, inside edge back onto the pad
tossed up outside off, lunges forward, smothers the spin and defends
length on off, whipped away to deep midwicket using the depth of the crease and his wrists
short outside off and he has latched onto that, pulled wide of long-on for four
full and drifting in, tries to tap it on its head, but can't beat short fine-leg
full outside off, opens the face and pushes it to point
slower and shorter, goes back and has to reach for it a little to push it to deep cover
full on off, pushed with soft hands to cover's left and they scamper a single
short on off, hangs back and pushes it to long-on to bring up his 11th ODI fifty. He's been lucky but he has utilised it
length on middle, goes down on one knee and helps it along to deep backward squareleg
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
round arm delivery, dragged down outside off, pushed to deep point
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
short outside off, slight drift away and Rashid is beaten on the cut
short outside off, punched to deep cover
length outside off, pushed to cover
full on middle, makes a little room and pushes it to long-off
length on middle, more turn and bounce as he lunges forward to defend
full on middle, pushed to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to deep cover
full on middle, skips down the wicket, gets too close to it so only ,manages to push it to long-on
full on middle, comes down wicket and picks him up with the spin, bisecting long-on and deep midwicket
length on off, sharp turn into the batsman, defended back
full on off, swept but gets only a thick inside edge to short fine-leg
short outside off, looks to cut but can't get any bat on it
quicker one on off, hangs back and looks to cut, nearly chops it back on
length on middle, pushed to long-on
that's an outrageous stroke, six over extra cover off the backfoot! Short outside off, rocks back and lifts him up and over, gets an incredible amount of power behind it and it sails over the fence
full on middle, down the wicket comes Rashid and hammers him to long-on, who moves quickly to his left to restrict them to one
length outside off, pushed to deep cover
short and hammered over deep midwicket! Used the depth of the crease nicely and picked him up powerfully
length on middle, turned around towards midwicket
length outside off, looks to pull and nearly drags it back onto his stumps
quicker one, wide and full as he sees Rashid advancing down, manages to reach it with his hands and push it to deep cover
full outside off, comes down and pushed it to long-off
full on off, pushed to cover
round arm delivery, length outside off, uses the pace and scoops him over the keeper
full on middle and out comes the reverse sweep, bit of a top edge but enough behind it to clear the short third-,man, who made a very lazy effort there
length on middle, pushed to long-on
length on middle, down the wicket comes Rashid and picks him up towards deep midwicket for another four
makes room, the bowler pushes it full and wide, Rashid manages to reach it and loft it over the cover field., few bounces and down to deep cover for one
Hammered over extra cover! Full and fast outside off, he gets under it and goes inside out to bring up the 200 in style

down the wicket, smart bowling as he pushes it wide and full, Rashid slices it over point, deep cover cuts it off but the throw to the keeper isn't strong enough to beat Rashid, who was struggling to get there, but eventually did
full toss on off, shuffles across but has to settle for a push to long-off
full and wide outside off, squeezes it away
full toss on off, lofted down to long-off, collects after a couple of bounces but was slow to the ball and they turn for two
That's a helicopter shot from Rashid Khan and with a mere flick of the wrist he manages to clear long-off
wide outside off and called
down the track, fired outside off, keeper takes the bails off and the third umpire has been called. It's a wide but has he got his man? No, he's made that back comfortably

full outside off, Rashid walked across off stump a little and left it alone, hoping that the umpire would call it a wide but it wasn't. However, he's done his job, another brilliant rearguard effort from Rashid Khan
full on off, driven back to the bowler
full outside off, pushed back where it came from
length outside off, left alone
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
full on middle, comes forward and pushes to midwicket again
flat and quick and on middle, lunges forward and taps it to the leg side
length on middle, tucking him up, defended to the leg side
full outside off, leans into it and caresses it through the cover field, timed to perfection for four
length on the pads, nudged to fine-leg
full on the pads, clipped straight to midwicket
length, drifting into the pads and clipped away to the deep squareleg fence
full outside off, comes forward and defends to cover
full outside off, lunges forward and defends
full on middle, defended
full and drifting in, pushed to midwicket
length outside off, bit of width and he throws his hands at it, piercing the cover field with incredible power
full on middle, quicker, pushes forward and defends
googly outside off, slower through the air, drawing him forward, pushes at it and plays outside the line to be beaten on the inside edge
short on middle, rocks back and helps it along towards fine-leg, beating the deep backward squareleg to his left
full outside off and crunched straight to mid-off
length outside off, pushed to cover-point
length on off, turned with the wrists to midwicket
short on off, looks for the pull again, through the shot a little early and takes on the body
length outside off, tries to blast it through the covers, doesn't get the timing or placement
length on off, pushes forward and defends
full on off, shuffles and pushes it back to the bowler
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
length on middle, not offering any room, defends to the leg side
length outside off, pushed to cover without any timing
full outside off, comes forward and defends
length and angled in, cramping the batsman for room, defended from the crease
length and too straight this time, the angle allows him to just tickle it fine and it races to the fence
full outside off, overpitched and he blasts it through the covers, races to the fence despite the fact that the diving fielder got a hand to it
short outside off, he was on the walk slightly but gets on top of the bounce hammers it past point's right for another four
slower ball, angled in, defended to the leg side
length on the pads, misses the flick but the deflection off the pad trickles towards squareleg to allow one
length, angled in, tapped away to the legside and they come through for a quick single
full on the pads, tucked away through the vacant squareleg region for one
full outside off, lunges forward and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
googly, tossed up, comes forward and defends with hard hands, getting another inside edge to the leg side
full on middle, defended
length on middle, pushes at it with hard hands again, gets an outside edge, which eludes slip to his right and races to the fence
tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
length on off, punched back to the bowler
length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
massive appeal turned down! Went for the sweep, it was too full for the stroke and he was struck just marginally outside the line of off stump
full on off, pushed to mid-off's left, who has to put in a dive
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
length outside off, pushed to cover-point
slower and full outside off, lunges forward, gets low and defends
length outside off, punched to cover
short on off, rocks back and pulls him in front of square for four. Releases the pressure
full on off, comes forward and defends it back
full outside off, skips down the wicket and picks him up towards deep midwicket, there are cries of catch it but it was wide of the fielder, safe shot
full on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on and they come through for one
full on middle, tries to swing it to the leg side, got too close to the ball and the inside edge goes past his stumps, down to fine-leg for a couple
full on off, defended
full on the pads, pushed to squareleg

full on middle and Stirling picks him up over long-on with ease. Didn't get to the pitch of it, had to reach for it a little but went through with the stroke, and the extension of the arms carries it all the way
short outside off, punched straight to cover
full on the pads, comes forward, gets low and pushes it to midwicket
full outside off, lunges forward and defends again
short outside off, punched through the covers and wide of the deep fielder for two
length on middle, hint of turn away as he pushed at it, got a leading edge, but luckily wide of slip
full on middle, comes forward and defends
full on middle, pushed to long-on
full on off, lunges forward and defends
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
full outside off, comes forward, opens the face and pushes it to point
length outside off, punched to cover, who makes an excellent stop diving to his right
full on off, comes forward and defends
not the most auspicious start, full and wide and Stirling pounces on it, hammering it through the covers to welcome the him with four
length on the pads, defended
length, sliding across, defended
length on middle, sharp turn back in and down the leg side
full on middle, sharp turn again, gets a thick inside edge to short fine-leg as he pushed at it
length on the pads, goes deep in his crease to tuck away towards squareleg for one

through him with a googly and that's the debutant's maiden wicket! length on off, Porterfield lunged forward in hope rather than with any sense of conviction, was beaten by the sharp turn back in to be cleaned up between bat and pad
length, angled across, pushed to long-on
full on the pads, comes forward and tucks it away through squareleg
full on off, pushed to long-on
length outside off, goes straight on with the arm, comes forward to defend it, beaten on the outside edge
full on middle, tucked away to midwicket for one
full outside off, goes down on one knee and nails the sweep, all along the ground, beating the deep backward squareleg to his right
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
full outside off, pushed to cover
full outside off, sliding on with the arm, pushed to cover
length on middle, turn back in beats the batsman on the inside edge, struck on the thigh pad
appeal for lbw but turned down. Length on middle, sharp turn back in again, the batsman, rooted to the crease, gets an inside edge back on to the pad
full on off, pushed to cover
length on off, goes deep in his crease and pushes it to long-on
full on middle, pushed to long-on
full outside off, comes forward and defends
length, angled across, comes forward and defends
full on the pads, comes forward and tucks it around the corner, towards squareleg
full on the pads, nudged to midwicket's right for one
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg
full outside off, driven to long-on
full on the pads, gets down and sweeps it down to deep backward squareleg. If it's that full, they don't have to worry about picking him
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
better length, on middle, skidding though a little, he went back to it but managed to get some bat on it and nudge it towards squarleg
length on middle, tucked away to midwicket's right for one
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
short outside off, chops it away to deep point's left for two
full on middle, bounce and turn, lunges forward and gets it high on the bat but falls safely to the off side
length on middle, tucked away to squareleg for one
full outside off, driven straight to cover
short outside off, looks for the cut but can't beat point
full outside off, driven to deep cover
full outside off, shuffles and goes down for the sweep, getting outside the line of off stump and gets it away along the ground to deep backward squareleg
full on off, driven to deep cover
googly outside off, but too full, swept to deep squareleg again
full on middle, and another sweep down to deep backward squerleg
length on middle, turn and bounce back in, off the pad it lobs up to the keeper. Better length that, he's been bowling too full otherwise
full outside off, leans into the drive and crunches it through the covers for four
length outside off, hangs back and pushes it to cover
short outside off, poor bowling and he pounces on that opportunity to cut. Rashid overcompensated for the overpitched delivery and gets cut away
length outside off, left alone
full on off, comes forward and defends it back to the bowler, who lets it though his fingers and allows one
length on the pads, tucked away towards squareleg for one
full on middle, pushed to long-on
full on off, defended with a big stride out
turning into the batsman from outside off, he gets behind the line and defends
googly, but he stays put in his crease and defends in the offside. Seemed to have read it
more flight and bounce on this one, pitched on middle and leg and came back into him, struck him on the thigh pad when he missed the attempted flick
short ball on off stump, he went for the pull but missed it. The ball lobs towards point off his upper arm
back of a length, coming into him from around the wicket, he defends from his crease
length ball, nipping back into him from off stump and he works it with the angle to deep square leg

misfield by point brings a run. Najibullah didn't get his body behind the ball and was done in by a bit of an awkward bounce, allowing the ball through. It was a fullish delivery, seaming in from outside off and Balbirnie played a pleasing drive. Shouldn't have got a run for it though, but did
fullish ball coming in with the seam from outside off, defended into the offside
length ball on off, he works it with the angle to deep square leg to raise a fine fifty He has ensured Ireland are well on course here with his innings
very wide down leg - so wide in fact that it beats the keeper too and goes for five wides. This drifted and turned, bad ball
full on the stumps, worked to short fine leg
length ball, going across the batsman. He stays in his crease and punches it firmly through a vacant point region
full ball on leg, turned to short midwicket
ooh lovely, beaten. Nicely flighted, draws him forward, pitches on middle and it's the wrong un, breaks past the bat. Misses the outside edge
fuller on the stumps, flicked to deep square leg
beaten again. A bit wider outside off, another googly. He doesn't connect with the drive
back of a length coming in on the stumps, pushed to the bowler's right
good length on a sixth stump line, he lets it go through
short of a length well outside off, slashed to third man
too full outside off and he gets down on one knee to drive it peachily through cover, but there is a sweeper back so he'll only get one
back of a length coming into him, defended back from the back foot
good length on a fourth stump line, he opens the face of the bat to guide it to third man. A misfield there allows a second
fullish length outside off, he comes forward to defend, but it's the wrong un and takes an inside edge to square leg. They steal a quick single
too short, outside off and turning away, cut well but straight to point
tossed up outside off but too full, which allows him to drive to the man on the point fence
very full on the stumps, he comes forward to defend but can't quite get to the pitch of the ball. It breaks and takes a thick outside edge to third man
flicked to midwicket
length ball, googly outside off, stays in his crease and defends
fullish on off, defended back
full ball on off again, he defends solidly off the front foot
punched for four back of a length just outside off, it wasn't that for away from the body but Stirling punch-drove it with power and timing, beating the fielder at third man
fuller ball on the stumps, he taps it into the offside with soft hands to get a quick single
good length on off, Balbirnie drives firmly but straight to mid-off
too short, but doesn't rise very high, pulled to deep square leg from waist-height along the ground
full ball on the stumps, he walks into the drive to long-on
ooh, some nice turn and drift there. Drifts and lands on leg, he stretches forward to defend, but it takes the outside edge towards backward point
beauty the perfect legspinner's delivery, loops and draws him forward, dips, and then turns past the outside edge
another quick leggie, and he has to scramble to get his bat down in time to keep it out
too full outside off and driven with one knee down to wide long-off
tossed up on the stumps but a touch too full, driven to short cover
flattish and full outside off, he moves across and punches it to long-on
tossed up a bit more, turns in from outside off, defended off the front foot
nicely swept, that's a shot Balbirnie plays well. Picked this from middle stump and sent it along the ground to deep square leg
fuller on off, he stretches forward to defend
length ball outside off, he punches it firmly but straight to extra cover
length ball outside off, he steers it away towards point

another beauty, and Shahzad is pleading with the umpire but not given out. Stirling was caught hanging back to this length delivery that spun sharply from middle stump. It caught his thigh pad on the way to the keeper. Great call by the umpire
fuller outside off, stretched forward to defend
ooh my word, Rashid is asking questions of the batsmen. Big stride going forward to a length ball outside off and it just got straight on, whistling past the outside edge again
length ball again on middle, turns from there but Stirling is more prepared this time and manages to push it to point's right to pinch a single
big turning leggie beats slip pitched on off and spun a long way, defeated his attempted drive and kicked up enough that the lone slip couldn't latch on to it either
tossed up on off but too full, and driven easily down to long-on for a comfortable single
tossed up again outside off, and he went for the drive but the ball seemd to stop a bit, so he checked the shot, one bounce to the bowler
watched it carefully so even though it bounced a bit lower, he transferrred weight back and pushed it for a single
brings out the sweep again, and connects well to send it to deep square leg
fuller outside off, cut away but short third man fields
that one's out of here Nabi gave it some air, a bit too much and Stirling was down on one knee slog-sweeping to glory. Connects beautifully and sends the ball high over deep midwicket
googly, and he bring his bat down in time to jab it away
fuller on middle and leg, he comes forward to push it to long-on
too short, wrong un misdirected, pitches on leg and goes further down. Given a wide. Perhaps it flicked the flap of hte pad
fuller, inviting him to drive the wrong un, but he managed to push it into the offside

given lbw and Stirling's not happy The ball was another peach, landed on middle and off and turned away, struck him on the pad. He was going back and trying to defend. But not only would the turn have taken it past the off stump, he was also struck outside the line. Big wicket that, and very unlucky for Ireland and Stirling, who has to go after playing a gem
keeps it in the channel on a length and turns a smidge, Simi stays inside the line and lets it go through
dip and turn again, Simi brings his bat down rather late and squirts it off the outside edge to third man
fuller outside off, pushed into the offside
beauty, defeats his forward push, turning away from outside off
he goes back to the tried and tested sweep, takes it from outside off, deep square leg fields
length ball, spinning into him, gets behind it and plays it with a straight bat
length ball, a bit wider outside off, he tries to cut but misses
full ball, defended off the front foot
wrong un, watched it carefully and flicked it to deep square leg
tossed up on leg stump, pushed into the legside
big turn on the wrong un and loud appeal but given not out. Hit him in line with the stumps from outside off, but the turn would have probably taken it down leg
great length and line, just outside off, drawing him forward and spinning past the outside edge
too short, and though there's big turn Simi could get into position and steer it away towards third man. Spirited chase by the sub Shahidi, who slides and pulls it in, saves a run.
back of a length on middle and off, turning leggie, he tries to punch but gets an inside edge onto pad
defended off the back foot
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to defend
very full outside off, he drives forcefully but only gets the toe-end to mid-off
length ball on off, driven through cover off the back foot
length ball on off, steered towards short third man
full ball on the stumps, drives to long-on off the front foot
tossed up but too full outside off and Balbirnie drives it well opening the face of the bat to beat the man at short third man and find the fence
angled across, fullish length outside off, he lets it through
too full, ends up a full toss, pushed through cover
loses his line completely, way down leg and it's a wide
fuller ball on off stump, driven off the toe-end to mid-off who had just come in. They pinch a single anyway, the fielder was slow to react. That was Rahmat Shah
quicker on the stumps, defended back from the stumps
fuller on the stumps, stretches forward to defend
full outside off, pushed to cover
full on off, comes forward and defends
length, fired into the pads, tucked away towards squareleg
full on middle, driven to long-on and Balbirnie goes to fifty
full on the pads, nudged to short fine-leg
length on the pads, skidding on, clipped to midwicket
overpitched outside off, too full, too wide and he caresses it through the covers for four

Is that Afghanistan's opening? pitched on middle, googly, not picked by the batsman who was rooted to crease and struck on the pad. Would it have missed off? Doesn't matter as the umpire reckoned it would have hit
full on off, pushed to cover
tossed up outside off, slow through the air, drawing him forward, deceived him in the air as he looked to push at it, chipped past the bowler
length outside off, spinning back in, Balbirnie rocks back and defends late, right under his eyes
full outside off, swept away to deep backward squareleg
length on the pads, punched to long-on
length outside off, cut away to deep point for one
full on off, comes forward and defends
length on middle, sharp turn back in had the batsman in an awful tangle, and nearly went back onto the stumps off the thigh pad
full outside off, breaks away off the surface beating the outside edge
length on the stumps, skids onto the batsman, who brings his bat down on it just in time to survive
slower and drifting down the leg side, the batsman misses the flick and the keeper goes up in a massive appeal but turned down
full on off, comes forward and the extra bounce catches his splice, to nearly lob back to the bowler
length on middle, turn back in, uses that and the depth of his crease to tuck it away through squareleg
full on the pads, tucked away through squareleg again
full and angled across, pushed to point
length, angled across, pushed through by Nabi, the batsman hangs back and gets a thick outside edge to point
full on off, pushed to mid-off
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
length on the pads, goes for the sweep, there's a top edge but couple of bounces before it gets to deep backward squareleg
full on middle, clears his leg and pushes it back to the bowler, who lets it through his hands to allow one down to long-on
full outside off, lunges forward and defends
full outside off, overpitched and driven to deep cover
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on the pads, the deflection takes it towards squareleg for one
full on middle, was rooted to the crease and slightly late on it but manages to keep it out
length outside off, goes for the pull, it's not short enough for the stroke, skids through and just goes over the off stump
length on the pads, tries to tuck it away and is struck on the thigh pad after he closed the face too early
length outside off, crunched straight to mid-off, they run with the shot and O'Brien would have had to walk back had there been a direct hit from Rashid Khan at the non striker's end
slower ball on off, hangs back, waits for it, pushes it to point' right and a lazy bit of running at the non striker's could have led to a run-out had there been a direct hit at the bowler's end
length on the pads, uses the angle to help it along to short fine-leg and they scamper another singe. Missed out there, either side of the fielder would have earned him four
googly, short on middle, perhaps not picked but goes through with the pull and manages to get enough power behind it to the deep midwicket fence even as he lost control with his bottom hand
full outside off, pushed to cover
length on the pads, spins down the leg side
full outside off and hammered down the ground. Overpitched and he got under it nicely to hit it flat and hard
full on middle, slower and deceives him in the air as he looks for the hoick to the leg side, gets an inside edge to short fine-leg
full on middle, picks it up to long-on for one
full outside off, drawing him forward, he goes though to drive a little early and gets an inside edge to the vacant midwicket region for one
length outside off, pushed through the covers, lazy fielding on the fence and a weak throw allow them to come through for two
length outside off, steered to point
short ball, swivels and pulls it along the ground to deep midwicket
full toss outside off, gets a thick outside edge to third-man's left, they consider two but eventually decide against it
short on the pads, swivels and helps along the ground to fine-leg, easy pickings
length, angled in, misses the flick and is struck on the thigh but it was too high and slipping down the leg side
length on middle, skids on a little, pushed to deep cover
length on middle, uses the depth of the crease and pushes it to the midwicket region
length on off, hangs back and pushes it to deep cover
full on middle, clears his left leg to allow the bat to come through, chips it just short of long-off
length on middle, pushed to cover
full on middle, pushed past the bowler, down to long-on for one
full on middle, pushed to long-on
length on middle, hangs back and pushes it to long-on
googly, tossed up on off, pushed to long-off for one
short outside off, punched through the covers, down to deep cover for one
quicker one, pitched on off, deviated sharply back in off the surface and through the gap between bat and pad as he remained rooted to the crease
length outside off, punched to deep cover's left and they come through for two
full on off, spins sharply away as the batsman lunges forward to defend it
full on middle, pushed to cover
full on off, slight turn away, the batsman defended with soft hands, getting a thick outside edge but all along the ground, past slip's right and down to third-man for four

length outside off, cut away past point, they look for two, the batsman has to hurry through as the throw is right above the stumps and Shahzad whips the bails off. Third-umpire called. He was well in, however
full on off, comes forward and defends
length outside off, too close to the body to flay his hands through that one, drags it back onto the stumps
full toss down the legside, tickled away down to fine-leg and that's the match
